Package tools.gui.border

Class IOBorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.gui.border.IOBorder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, javax.swing.border.Border, PublicCloneable
    @Deprecated(forRemoval=true)
public class IOBorder
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.border.Border, PublicCloneable
    Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    This class relies heavily on ImageManager, which was completely refactored, and behaviour of this class has not yet been tested with the new implementation.
    Border-like users should use SheetBorder instead, as the dependancy with the ImageManager is completely removed there.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT

        public static final int DEFAULT
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        TODO The states of the border. Note that, if necessary added. These values are used for the determining the images to choose on the x-axis. If you want to set a new created state, one can simply set the border state with setState(int). Note that states with a value that is smaller than 0 will be set to the default value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setState

        public void setState​(int state)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        Sets the new state of the border. Note that more states then the given DEFAULT, ROLL_OVER, PRESSED and DISABLED can be used. State values less then 0 will be set to the default value.
        Parameters:
        state - the new state of the border.

      • getState
